How P Works¶

P was designed from the ground up to be a modularized, fast, real-time web framework. The basis of P is to be a collection of Modules, which extend the P Object. The P Object is supposed to be available almost anywhere in the framework. By having access to the P object, you have access to nearly everything the framework has to offer, on a single-user basis.

The Goals of P¶

  • Be Modular - P should be able to be adapted, taken apart, minimized, or maximized via Modules.
  • Be Real-Time - Live updating and synchronization/collaboration across multiple users.
  • Desktop-esque - Writing a P app should be more like writing a desktop app than writing a web app.
  • Re-usable - P code should be written from a component-based reusable standpoint, unlike most web frameworks.
